QuestionStem: Decide if the effect described is caused by a genetic or environmental factor.

cells.label: A hawk is better able to catch prey than other hawks in the population because it has longer claws.
A male lion is unable to compete with other male lions in the population for territory and mates because he is small and weak.
A young deer does not grow well when a disease kills the trees it relies on for food.
Salmon die off because the water they live in has been contaminated with pollution.

CorrectFeedback: Some animals have genetic traits, such as longer claws, that give them an advantage over other animals. Genetic factors can also be a disadvantage if they result in traits that make it difficult for an animal to obtain food or compete for territory and mates. Environmental factors, such as available food, water, and pollution can positively or negatively affect the growth of animals.
PartiallyCorrectFeedback: Think about whether the factor is inherited or not.
IncorrectFeedback: Think about whether the factor is inherited or not.
FinalIncorrectFeedback: Some animals have genetic traits, such as longer claws, that give them an advantage over other animals. Genetic factors can also be a disadvantage if they result in traits that make it difficult for an animal to obtain food or compete for territory and mates. Environmental factors, such as available food, water, and pollution can positively or negatively affect the growth of animals.
